required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adjuvanted Seasonal Recombinant QVLP Influenza Vaccine in Adults 65 Years of Age and Older
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Partially-Blinded, Active Comparator-Controlled, Dose-Ranging, Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity Phase 1/2 Study of an Adjuvanted Seasonal Recombinant QVLP Influenza Vaccine in Adults 65 Years of Age and Older

brief_summary.textblock:
This randomized, partially-blinded, active comparator-controlled will be conducted at multiple sites. The composition of QVLP to be used in this study includes a mix of recombinant H1, H3, and two B hemagglutinin proteins expressed as VLPs and will be based on the 2020-2021 influenza virus strains.
Approximately 120 healthy adult subjects 65 years of age and older are planned for randomization in a 1:1:1 ratio to receive QVLP at a dose of 30 µg/strain with AS03 adjuvant or QVLP (30 µg/strain) (unadjuvanted) or Fluzone HD Quad.
Subjects will participate in this study approximatly 12 months, during which a first visit will be scheduled on Day 0 for screening and vaccine administration.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage, intensity and relationship to vaccination of immediate adverse events (AEs)

primary_outcome.measure: Solicited local and systemic adverse events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage and intensity of solicited local and systemic adverse events (AEs) following vaccination
Percentage, intensity and relationship of unsolicited adverse events (AEs) following vaccination
Number of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis
Percentage of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis
Number of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis
Percentage of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis

primary_outcome.measure: Serious adverse events (SAEs), adverse events (AEs) leading to withdrawal, adverse events of special interest (AESIs), medically attended adverse event (MAAEs), new onset of chronic disease (NOCDs) and deaths
primary_outcome.description: Occurrences of serious adverse events (SAEs), adverse events (AEs) leading to withdrawal, adverse events of special interest (AESIs), medically attended adverse event (MAAEs), new onset of chronic disease (NOCDs) and deaths

primary_outcome.measure: HI antibody response induced by adjuvanted and unadjuvanted QVLP and Fluzone HD Quad against the homologous influenza strain
primary_outcome.description: HI antibody response induced by adjuvanted and unadjuvanted QVLP and Fluzone HD Quad against the homologous influenza strains on Day 28, compared to Day 0 values. HI antibody titers will be analyzed using the following parameters: geometric mean titers (GMT), seroconversion (SC) rate, seroprotection (SP) rate, and geometric mean fold rise (GMFR).

secondary_outcome.measure: MN antibody response induced by adjuvanted and unadjuvanted QVLP and Fluzone HD Quad against the homologous influenza strains
secondary_outcome.description: MN antibody response induced by adjuvanted and unadjuvanted QVLP and Fluzone HD Quad against the homologous influenza strains on Day 28, compared to Day 0 values. MN antibody titers will be analyzed using the following parameters: GMT, SC rate, and GMFR

secondary_outcome.measure: HI antibody response induced by adjuvanted and unadjuvanted QVLP and Fluzone HD Quad against the heterologous influenza strains
secondary_outcome.description: HI antibody response induced by adjuvanted and unadjuvanted QVLP and Fluzone HD Quad against the heterologous influenza strains on Day 28, compared to Day 0 values. HI antibody titers will be analyzed using the following parameters: GMT, SC rate, SP rate, and GMFR
Durability of antibody responses, as determined by HI and MN titers against homologous influenza strains (6 and 12 months post-vaccination)

Percentage, intensity and relationship to vaccination of immediate adverse events (AEs) stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine the 12 months prior to study vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Solicited local and systemic adverse events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage and intensity of solicited local and systemic adverse events (AEs) following vaccination stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

Percentage, intensity and relationship of unsolicited adverse events (AEs) following vaccination stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

Number of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

Percentage of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

Number of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

Percentage of subjects with normal and abnormal, clinically significant urine, haematological and blood biochemistry values, and urinalysis stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Serious adverse events (SAEs), adverse events (AEs) leading to withdrawal, adverse events of special interest (AESIs), medically attended adverse event (MAAEs), new onset of chronic disease (NOCDs) and deaths
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrences of serious adverse events (SAEs), adverse events (AEs) leading to withdrawal, adverse events of special interest (AESIs), medically attended adverse event (MAAEs), new onset of chronic disease (NOCDs) and deaths stratified by prior influenza vaccination status, if >25% of the enrolled subjects have received a standard influenza vaccine during the 12 months prior to study vaccination

arm_group.description: Treatment group 2: 30 µg/strain QVLP vaccine adjuvanted with AS03
Treatment group 4: 30 µg/strain QVLP vaccine unadjuvanted
Treatment group 5: 60 µg/strain Fluzone HD Quad vaccine

intervention.description: On Day 0, subjects will receive one intramuscular (IM) injection into the deltoid region of the non-dominant (if possible) arm.
